critique: The document is an executive order amending a previous order to remove gender-specific terms from the Code of Conduct for members of the US Armed Forces. The language is formal and legalistic. The overall tone is serious and resolute, reflecting the gravity of military service and the importance of the Code of Conduct. There is an element of patriotism and dedication to freedom conveyed through the amended articles of the Code. Initial assessment: Joy: 1, Sadness: 1, Anger: 1, Fear: 1, Disgust: 1, Surprise: 1. Revised assessment: Joy: 1, Sadness: 1, Anger: 1, Fear: 1, Disgust: 1, Surprise: 1.
